channel.title: Android on Damien Saunders
channel.description: Recent content in Android on Damien Saunders

item.title: Android 4.0 Galaxy Nexus impressive boot animation
item.description: Have you been impressed by the startup boot animation for Android ICS – I wonder if other Android 4.0 devices have the same startup animation?

item.title: Get Results from an Android Mobile Marketing Strategy
item.description: Android Mobiles are taking over the world … and that seems to be supported by the latest statistics or _trends. _If you’re thinking about mobile marketing .. and wondering ‘what is all the fuss about Android’, then this presentation is for you. Only the latest Android Insights and Statistics 10 billion app downloads (December 2011) 200 million activated devices (November 2011) 400,000 Android Apps (December 2011) We can only wait for the next Google I/O conference to confirm how these numbers are growing!

item.title: I just got my Google Galaxy Nexus
item.description: Looking forward to some Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich now I got me a new phone. The Google Galaxy Nexusarrived today and all I can say is BIG SCREEN. I think the next year will see me managing projects involving NFC, mobile payments, banking and hoping for some great Internet of Things apps.

item.title: Revolutionary – I just rooted my HTC Sensation
item.description: Is Revolutionary the easiest tool? (answer – no) If you’ve been keeping up with the world of custom rom’s to root your Android you may have heard about this. Revolutionary doesn’t get much of a mention as it’s still an Alpha release, but it does bring together to great development teams. Revolutionary is only for Linux or Windows users and really supports the newer range of Android devices like the HTC Sensation

item.title: 4 of the best Android apps for Wifi
item.description: I’ve been writing about Android for some time now. Here are 4 of the best Android apps for Wifi. These apps allow you to find public wi-fi networks, turn your phone into a wifi hotspot and a bit more. HTC Wifi Hotspot This app can’t be downloaded from the market – its part of HTC build for Android 2.2 Froyo I’ve used this loads of times – its great for getting my laptop or iPad on the Internet when needed, but the main point to remember is it kills your battery very fast.

item.title: Cyanogenmod 7.1 RC1
item.description: Have you updated? – the first release candidate for Cyanogenmod v7.1 has been pushed out today. This update adds (more) support for Android 2.3.4 a number of Android devices from Samsung, LG, Motorola and the HTC Incredible. Here’s a summary of nice features from the changelog: Common: Support for revoking application permissions Common: Latest Superuser app Common: Control brightness by sliding on statusbar Common: ADWLauncher- Transitions, catalog improvements, bugfixes Common: Optional GMT correction for SMS/MMS timestamps

item.title: Android 10 best articles you love to read
item.description: It’s time to catchup on some missed out reading and get out in the sun. So here is a collection of 10 of the best Android resources that you love to read. So I’m not going to second guess these related posts – I’m sure there will be stuff about Cyanogenmod, Wifi Settings and some best apps. [related_posts limit=”10″]

item.title: HTC Sensation preorder with Carphone Warehouse
item.description: Have you seen this in your email? The new HTC Sensation is ready for pre-sales orders via Carphone Warehouse starting from £35 per month

item.title: Android apps run full screen on Honeycomb Tablets
item.description: Google recently announced some exciting new features for Android 3.0 Honeycomb. Most notably, Android 3.0 sees tablets and mobile devices merge to the same code base. This is kind of like having one OS for all devices. There are interface design considerations that need to be understood before launching your app on the big screen. Android Apps run full screen – Interface Design The key point to note is that Android apps run in full screen on tablets.

item.title: Android Apps – 400% growth rate YOY
item.description: Android in numbers – thankfully the Google I/O conference helped out by publishing statistics which give some insight to the growth in adoption of smartphones and also help to provide a hint of reality. But these are BIG BIG BIG numbers. Android Smartphones, Tablets & Devices Over 100M Android devices activated worldwide with 400K activations added every day More than 310 Android devices from 36 different manufactures Android cellphones are on more than 216 mobile carriers in 112 countries Android Market 200,000 free and paid applications available in Android Market 4.

item.title: Android – Best Apps for WiFi – refreshed for 2011
item.description: I’ve been writing about Android for some time now and Best Android Apps for Wifi is a very popular post. So here is a refreshingly new look for 2011 at some of the best wi-fi apps for your smartphone. Auto Wifi Enabler This was a fav app for a month – til I realised I only ever needed 2 wifi hotspots – the one at work and the one at home.

item.title: Cyanogenmod – How to download big apps on your SD Card
item.description: Are you suffering from Android Market download issues? Have you just rooted your Android with Cyanogenmod and found you can’t download Google Maps? If you can’t download Google Maps it’s because most Android phones have a download cache limited to 3MB and Google Maps is a whooping 5.4MB. How to Download large files after rooting your Android The answer to your problems is S2E simple2ext – which moves your download cache off the phone to your SD Card.

item.title: Cyanogenmod 7.0.3 – have you updated?
Cyanogenmod 7.02 have you updated
item.description: Have you updated? – the latest Cyanogenmod v7.02 has been released. Mostly it fixes bugs and ‘actually’ fixes GPS. Being a point release its not focused on new features – but if you haven’t updated then you should. As always backup your current Rom before installing this update. Summary from the changelog: Common: Fix issue with missing built-in themes Common: Update bundled ROM Manager to latest version Supersonic: Actually fix GPS Supersonic: Fix proximity and light sensor You can download it via the Clockwork Rom Manager or manually.

item.title: Best Android App for technical info Network Info II
item.description: Mobile apps can be fun to use – but during mobile app testing you might need to diagnosing problems and finding bugs can be complicated. At least with Network Info II on your Android you have a pocket-encyclopedia with all the important information you need. At the basic level – Network Info II reports details on your mobile network connection, IP address, Wi-Fi connection, Bluetooth and details about your device and your sim card.

item.title: z4Root [I just rooted] Samsung Europa Android 2.2.1 (VFUK)
item.description: Is z4root the easiest tool? If you’ve been keeping up with the world of custom rom’s to root your Android you may have heard about this. z4root doesn’t get much of a mention – its key differentiator is that it is an untethered root tool – eg you run it from your mobile and not from your PC or Mac. I’ve got a Samsung Galaxy Europa prepay on Vodafone UK – I needed to do screenshots and the only good way to do this involves running root first.

item.title: Must have Android Apps for Marketing Consultants
item.description: What shortcuts or widgets should you save to the desktop of you Anrdoid phone? As a marketing consultant I’ve customised my phone lots (thanks to Cyanogenmod) .. but my desktop stays the same. I don’t have many widgets as they eat up battery life (and annoyingly want internet connection). What’s on your Android Desktop? Winamp – best music player for Android Now that I have a larger long-life battery – I’m back to listening to music on my phone.

item.title: Last.fm Android Live Wallpaper
item.description: I’ve just discovered the (not official) Last.fm live wallpaper for Android. It’s a brilliant change to my boring background on my HTC Desire. Last.fm is still there tracking my music listening habits – and doing a good job of that. This live wallpaper has a number of options and the free version allows you to create a wallpaper of your favourite artists for example. The idea for this (app) is also brilliant – it needs no real user interface – and for a small price you get a premium wallpaper with options for weekly charts.

item.title: HOWTO: Fix no mobile internet after Cyanogenmod install
item.description: Here’s a simple fix to problems of no Mobile Internet after installing Cyanogenmod rom on your Android. If you’re new to rooting your Android or just forgotten how complicated it can be to get online with your mobile phone – you might think this is a really useful tip. Check your APN Settings After you root your phone and install CyanogenMod you can find your have no wifi and no wireless internet connection.

item.title: Cyanogenmod 7RC3
item.description: I’ve just updated to the latest Cyanogenmod 7 release candidate 3 … it’s now looking very polished. Noticeable extras – application shortcut menus have a link to the Android Market. What have you noticed?

item.title: I upgraded to Cyanogenmod 7 on HTC Desire
item.description: I just updated my HTC Desire to the new Cyanogenmod 7 rom and it’s been running fine. A part of me does miss the HTC Sense UE overlay .. but … meh. If you have already rooted your phone and been using Clockwork ROM Manager, you just need to go looking for the new Cyanogenmod 7 RC1. The upgrade process is very simple – but here are a couple of pointers –

item.title: Android Market has a browser
item.description: Android users tend to download fewer apps – and this is because there is no computer application to easily browse and download apps in the same way that iTunes works for iOS devices. A few weeks back the revamped Android Market website was launched. But it still struggles to tie the phone to the computer. Android Market revamped The Android Market website has been around for a couple of years and generally featured static content.

item.title: Autodesk SketchBook Mobile comes to Android
item.description: SketchBook Mobile recently got a mention here as the best iPad app fro sketches, notes, photos and more … and now its available on Android. I bet if you have a Samsung Galaxy Tab – this should be the first app that really is worth paying for.With so many features – it can be hard to know where to start – so my suggestion is use it to play around with some of your photos.

item.title: How smartphone users see each other
item.description: Happy Friday everyone … Now go look at yourself in the mirror? Source: http://androidandme.com/2010/11/news/how-smartphone-users-see-each-other-android-vs-blackberry-vs-iphone-comic/

item.title: 3 must try Android Apps to manage wifi
item.description: Managing wifi on your Android mobile phone can be a hassle, so at least there are now 3 good apps for you to use to make your wifi experience better. Is the most technical looking of the 3 apps – turning it on was a bit of shock when compared to the user experience of the other 2 apps. WiFinder only has 1 button aptly labelled New Scan. You then press and hold on the WiFi SSID to see the more familar Android Wifi Connect.

item.title: HOW TO: Keep your Wifi connection awake on Android
item.description: Most people read this post because to find out how to change the Wifi settings on their Android phone. You might be wanting to save battery or figure out how to keep wifi on when your phone screen is off / idle. It’s very easy to change this setting and I prefer to keep wifi on when the phone is plugged into the mains power, this means your news and rss clients will synced overnight when you’re sleeping.

item.title: Android Markets – Going International – advice for developers, VCs & startups
item.description: Developing for Android? You need to look to the bigger picture … actually this applies to anyone developing apps for mobile phones. If you want your app to be used by people that don’t speak English you need to translate it and provide some support. There are going to be many opportunities for startups and anyone with a business model to go ‘international’ or expand abroad should check these points are covered in the marketing and product development plans.

item.title: Android Phones – product life cycle & how to choose
item.description: What with all the new Android phones, its time to look at the phones to not buy, unless you’re stuck for cash or just want your first touch phone. There are many terminal vendors and operators with Android phones to choose from HTC, Sony Ericsson, Motorolla, T-mobile, Vodafone and Google (HTC). General Points on Buying a Phone Why buy a phone on a contract the total cost of ownership over a 18 month or 2 year contract will be expensive.

item.title: Android Market would benefit Developer instead of Apple App Certification?
item.description: Develop apps for Android or develop mobile apps for Apple, some days its hard to figure out just what to do. On this website I’ve written a lot on Android phones and apps.Around 6000 apps have been removed from the Apple store recently due to their erotic nature. It’s not that Android Market has no quality control – Adult or Erotic does not exist as a content category in Android Market but dating apps or other soft-porn apps so far have not shown huge growth (ahem) on Android.

item.title: NewsRob best Android application for Google Reader
item.description: Newsrob is my favourite application for Android mobiles, it’s been covered in my 10Best Android Apps** list a few times. **Newsrob** integratess with your account for Google Reader (which allows you to manage and read all your RSS feeds). Newsrob recently turned 1 and celebrated by introducing a Pro version and an Adfunded Free Version.** What’s fantastic about Newsrob Pro Newsrob Prohas a new feature that is great for any social media or mobile specialist.

item.title: Foursquare Best Location Based Social Networking for Android UK Users
item.description: Android mobile owners in the UK will be pleased to know that location based social networkingapps have begun to improve and increase in the number of users. In the past few weeks, top location based social networks such as Brightkiteand Foursquarehave really improved the quality and details of UK locations.** ** It is a problem of user experience that meant many of these services had few UK users and no UK points of interest.

item.title: 10 things to do with your Android and a Barcode Scanner
item.description: There’s no better sound than the reassuring ‘Beep at the Checkout Register’. So now you have your own Android mobile phone …here’s a few barcode scanning things you can do at home or in the shops. First you need the best Android Barcode Scanner – which now has integration with Google search on the mobile. Add a book to your Amazon Wishlist – just snap the barcode and save to list Catalogue your books at home using Anobiit from Anobii Catalogue your CD’s with Kooaba Look up reviews of that Wine you’ve just been drinking – Wine by the Bar is the perfect app for you Compare prices for that Electrical Gadget – Scan the Barcode and search online for it Create your own Barcode – After installing Barcode Scanner, open your Android Contacts .

item.title: DROID takes the Android to a new level
item.description: DROID sales in the USA and the robo-promotional ads from Verizon has boosted Android sales, so much so that hits on my blog have started to double since the new phone went on sale. Stats are good – Top searchs on Best Apps are going to my posts for Top Android Apps and 2 top Android apps from Google.

item.title: Sony Ericsson's first Android phone
item.description: Sony Ericsson delivered a blow to Microsoft on Tuesday when it unveiled its latest Xperia handset, which unlike its Windows-powered predecessors is based on Google’s Android operating system. Called X10, the flagship smartphone comes with a new Sony Ericsson-designed user interface that aggregates the user’s contacts and communications from the likes of Facebook and Twitter into a single address book. The system is akin to HTC’s Sense interface, and Motorola’s Motoblur interface, both of which feature on the respective companies’ new Android phones.

item.title: Is Android Lagging Behind in Sales? Not Likely
item.description: Recently the blogosphere has gone a bit crazy, excuse my lack of hyperbole about the Android platform. Was this ‘Android’ supposed to do battle with the iPhone? Just because no operators or manufacturers have openly commented about their smart phone sales figures doesn’t mean its bad news. Looking at the number of Android powered phones out now or due in the next 2 months shows a lot of promise HTC Hero – some bloggers say it’s the best Android yet G1 – the funny one with the flip out keyboard, still only with T-Mobile Magic – Vodafone took this and the Android platform global Tattoo – coming out again to Vodafone before xmas Motorola DEXT – a lifesaver for Motorola – probably the phone that saves them.

item.title: 10 Best Android Apps for your phone
item.description: Here’s a more up to date list featuring some of the best apps you must get on your Android phone. All of them are free in the Android Market. Some of them also have a freemium paid version. What’s good is that many of these you will use daily, but some of them will just sit on your phone and do what its supposed to do.(update: Nov 21 – Cyrket.com has been offline for some time … but is now around again – but try www.

item.title: 2 must have Android Apps to manage wifi
item.description: Have you just got a new HTC Magic? or waiting for the HTC Hero to come out? Here are 2 must have apps to get for free from the Android Market to manage your wifi and data connections Wefi – Manage your battery life and wi-fi connectivty Turn it on to see if there are free networks around you – once its found somewhere, it will login if its free or tell you it needs a password.

item.title: 2 Must have Android Apps from Google
item.description: Looking for somewhere to go …. Maybe you need to waste some time or want to find something else to try on your Google Android G1 or HTC Magic. Google obviously has embedded a lot things into the phone – but here are 2 apps that were not installed on the Android phone when you open the box. Places DirectoryPrice FREE Downloads >250,000 updated — 21 Sept –– Even before augmented reality became a buzzword … Google Places Directory was already bringing Google Maps together with GPS / Location Based Services.

item.title: Blow out the candles – Happy 1st Birthday Apple Apps Store
item.description: So its Happy Birthday to Apple and its App Store – 1 year old. Its created a new industry and probably will change the way everyone digests content – now that everything has an app or a widget you dont need to browse for it. Except for Search – Apple and the Apps store has changed how mobile phone manufacturers think about content like Nokia, RIM and Sony Ericsson all launched (or launching) app stores in the past 3 months.

item.title: Android Market Best of Apps you must have
item.description: 29 Sep 09: This is the better post to read: http://damien.co/2009/08/11/10-best-android-apps-for-your-phone/ Ok I’ve been using an HTC Magic for a few days now and I’m loving it … I’m so hooked I could almost get myself kicked out of the house, or have my ‘beautiful & precious’ phone smashed 🙁Here’s what you too should try there are so many free Apps in the Android Market that you can’t get bored. Given how much I use a phone and my focus on the mobiles and music, heres a choice selection
